description: On Monday, May 18, Tanzanian authorities lifted restrictions on systematic quarantine measures imposed on passengers to prevent the spread of the coronavirus disease. The mandatory 14-day quarantine period for those arriving into the country has been removed and only those who are showing symptoms of COVID-19 will be placed in quarantine unless they have proof of a negative test.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On August 1, 2020, in Tanzania individuals are no longer required to quarantine for 14 days on arrival. All international passengers will also be subject to temperature screening on arrival, and if passengers show symptoms of COVID-19 they will be subject to further testing and may be required to quarantine at a government-designated facility at their own costs.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On August 27, 2020, the Government of Tanzania has removed mandatory 14-day quarantine requirements for visitors on arrival, as well as the requirement for a negative COVID-19 test. If visitors show symptoms of COVID-19 on arrival, they may undergo enhanced screening and be required to take a COVID-19 test, followed by a 14-day self-isolation, depending on the result.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Tanzania on July 1, 2021, all travelers arriving from India or having traveled through India in the last 14 days will be subjected to 14-days mandatory quarantine at their own cost. Travelers subject to mandatory quarantine shall choose a place from the list designated by the Tanzanian government. Returning residents from India will be allowed to quarantine in their homes under a strict surveillance system.
